title.narrative: Promouvoir le dveloppement de la Riziculture dans la plaine de Bugarama

description.narrative: KOIMUNYA is a ooperative of rice farmers growing rice in the Bugarama lowlands in Rusizi District, Western Province of Rwanda. It is an area very favorable to rice growing. The 2,362 farmers produce good quantities of paddy, but far from being enough to supply the five rice processing factories in their area. Moreover, the infrastructures that the cooperative members use are very old and not enough, taking into account the current production quantities, which they plan to even increase further. Lack of transport means also hinders the smooth collection of paddy, which in addition has a negative impact on quality and quantity (post-harvest losses). Being a certified seed multiplier, KOIMUNYA lacks enough budget to take advantage of that facility. They wish to be given support to address these challenges and take advantage of that unsatisfied market (5 factories to supply). KOIMUNYA is the largest cooperatve in the area.

description.narrative: Sector: Water/Services .Beneficiaries: YALI Youth 803 of which 402 are women ..2 volunteer staff, 1 intern/trainee, 200 households will gain access to clean water (avg. household - 4 x 200 = 800) ...The grant will be used to pump underground water in form of boreholes. Then the water will be treated and purified to safe drinking standards for usage in household activities. After the production and purification process, the treated clean water will be delivered to peoples homes in all possible means via bicycles, delivering truck, and pipes dependent on what a customer prefers to use and can afford. ..The grant funds will be used to: (a) drill an additional borehole; (b) the purchase of a water storage tank; and (c) the construction of a piping system directly connected to the water storage tank. .
